Yet bend not all the harm upon yourself.
Yet Benedick was such another, and now is he become a man.
Yet Brutus says he was ambitious, And Brutus is an honorable man.
Yet but three?
Yet Caesar shall go forth, for these predictions Are to the world in general as to Caesar.
Yet could I bear that too, well, very well.
Yet Count Claudio may hear, for what I would speak of concerns him.
Yet do I not use my horse for my mistress, or any such proverb so little kin to the purpose.
Yet Edmund was beloved.
Yet fortune cannot recompense me better Than to die well, and not my master’s debtor.
Yet have I left a daughter.
Yet he hath ever but slenderly known himself.
Yet he looks successfully.
Yet hear me speak.
Yet hear me, countrymen.
Yet here she is allowed her virgin crants, Her maiden strewments, and the bringing home Of bell and burial.
Yet here, Laertes?
Yet here’s a spot.
Yet his means are in supposition.
Yet I beseech you, If you think fit, or that it may be done, Give me advantage of some brief discourse With Desdemona alone.
Yet I cannot choose but laugh To think it should leave crying and say “ay.” And yet, I warrant, it had upon its brow A bump as big as a young cockerel’s stone, A perilous knock, and it cried bitterly.
Yet I hate not Orlando.
Yet I have known those which have walked in their sleep who have died holily in their beds.
Yet I have not seen So likely an ambassador of love.
Yet I insisted; yet you answered not, But with an angry wafture of your hand Gave sign for me to leave you.
Yet I love thee too.
Yet I persuade myself to speak the truth Shall nothing wrong him.
Yet I profess curing it by counsel.
Yet I should kill thee with much cherishing.
Yet I suppose him virtuous, know him noble, Of great estate, of fresh and stainless youth.
Yet I will adventure.
Yet I’ll not shed her blood, Nor scar that whiter skin of hers than snow And smooth as monumental alabaster.
Yet if thou say Antony lives, is well, Or friends with Caesar, or not captive to him, I’ll set thee in a shower of gold and hail Rich pearls upon thee.
Yet if you there Did practice on my state, your being in Egypt Might be my question.
Yet in faith, if you did, it would not much approve me.
Yet is this no charm for the toothache.—Old Signior, walk aside with me.
Yet it was said It should not stand in thy posterity, But that myself should be the root and father Of many kings.
Yet keep the French the field.
Yet leave our cousin Katherine here with us.
Yet let me weep for such a feeling loss.
Yet marked I where the bolt of Cupid fell.
Yet must not we put the strong law on him.
Yet my heart Throbs to know one thing.
Yet once again proclaim it publicly, If any friend will pay the sum for him, He shall not die; so much we tender him.
Yet poor old heart, he holp the heavens to rain.
Yet put it out, for I would not be seen.
Yet say I, he is in love.
Yet she must die, else she’ll betray more men.
Yet that is but a crushed necessity, Since we have locks to safeguard necessaries And pretty traps to catch the petty thieves.
Yet the gold bides still That others touch, and often touching will Wear gold; yet no man that hath a name By falsehood and corruption doth it shame.
Yet there he was, and there I found this credit, That he did range the town to seek me out.
Yet they are not joined.
Yet this I will not do, do how I can.
Yet this is your harmless fairy, monster.
Yet thou didst kill my children.
Yet thou liest in the bleak air.
Yet touch this sparingly, as ’twere far off, Because, my lord, you know my mother lives.
Yet what can it when one can not repent?
Yet words do well When he that speaks them pleases those that hear.
Yet would I knew That stroke would prove the worst!
Yet would not so have been, Durst I have done my will.
Yet you are withered.
Yet you began rudely.
Yet you have all the vantage of her wrong.
Yet you will be hanged for being so long absent.
Yet you, the murderer, look as bright, as clear, As yonder Venus in her glimmering sphere.
Yet, coming from him, that great med’cine hath With his tinct gilded thee.
Yet, forgive me, God, That I do brag thus.
Yet, if you be out, sir, I can mend you.
Yet, in reason, no man should possess him with any appearance of fear, lest he, by showing it, should dishearten his army.
Yet, when I saw it last, it was besmeared As black as Vulcan in the smoke of war.
Yet, when we can entreat an hour to serve, We would spend it in some words upon that business, If you would grant the time.
Yield, cur.
Yon light is not daylight, I know it, I.
Yon ribaudred nag of Egypt— Whom leprosy o’ertake!—i’ th’ midst o’ th’ fight, When vantage like a pair of twins appeared Both as the same, or rather ours the elder, The breeze upon her, like a cow in June, Hoists sails and flies.
Yond island carrions, desperate of their bones, Ill-favoredly become the morning field.
Yond same black cloud, yond huge one, looks like a foul bombard that would shed his liquor.
Yonder comes my master, your brother.
Yonder sure they are coming.
Yonder they lie, the poor old man their father making such pitiful dole over them that all the beholders take his part with weeping.
Yonder, sir, he walks.
You a man?
You advise me well.
You all did see that on the Lupercal I thrice presented him a kingly crown, Which he did thrice refuse.
You all do know this mantle.
You always end with a jade’s trick.
You amaze me.
You appeared to me but as a common man.
You are a councilor.
You are a counterfeit cowardly knave.
You are a fishmonger.
You are a fool.
You are a fool.—You, niece, provide yourself.
You are a lover.
You are a merry man, sir.
You are a royal one, and we obey you.
You are a saucy boy.
You are a senator!
You are a spirit, I know.
You are almost come to part almost a fray.
You are an ass, you are an ass!
You are as well provided of both as any prince in the world.
You are both sure, and will assist me?
You are deceived.
You are dull, Casca, and those sparks of life That should be in a Roman you do want, Or else you use not.
You are early stirring.
You are full of pretty answers.
You are gentlemen of brave mettle.
You are he, you are he.
You are i' the right, sir, ’tis for my mistress.
You are idle, shallow things.
You are in the right.
You are looked for and called for, asked for and sought for, in the great chamber.
You are merry, my lord.
You are my elder.
You are my true and honorable wife, As dear to me as are the ruddy drops That visit my sad heart.
You are naught, you are naught.
You are not ignorant of what excellence Laertes is—
You are not Pinch’s patient, are you, sir?
You are not wood, you are not stones, but men.
You are not, Cassius.
You are now out of your text.
You are now within a foot Of th' extreme verge.
You are passing welcome, And so I pray you all to think yourselves.
You are pictures out of door, bells in your parlors, wild-cats in your kitchens, saints in your injuries, devils being offended, players in your housewifery, and housewives in your beds.
You are rather point-device in your accouterments, as loving yourself than seeming the lover of any other.
You are resolute, then?
You are the lord of duty.
You are their heir, you sit upon their throne, The blood and courage that renownèd them Runs in your veins; and my thrice-puissant liege Is in the very May-morn of his youth, Ripe for exploits and mighty enterprises.
You are there followed by a faithful shepherd.
You are thought here to be the most senseless and fit man for the constable of the watch; therefore bear you the lantern.
You are to blame, my lord, to rate her so.
You are too hot.
You are too indulgent.
You are too much mistaken in this king.
You are unkind, Demetrius.
You are very sensible, and yet you miss my sense: I mean, Hortensio is afeard of you.
You are very welcome, sir.
You are very well met.
You are welcome for his sake.
You are welcome to Elsinore.
You are welcome, masters, welcome, all!—I am glad to see thee well.—Welcome, good friends.—O old friend?
You are welcome, sir, to Cyprus.
You are welcome, sir.
You are welcome.
You are welcome.
You are welcome.
You are welcome.
You are well fleshed.
You are, and do not know ’t.
You beastly knave, know you no reverence?
You best know the place.
You bid me make it orderly and well, According to the fashion and the time.
You break jests as braggarts do their blades, which, God be thanked, hurt not.—My lord, for your many courtesies I thank you.
You bring me out.
You call me misbeliever, cutthroat dog, And spet upon my Jewish gaberdine— And all for use of that which is mine own.
You can do better yet, but this is meetly.
You can fool no more money out of me at this throw.
You cannot better be employed, Bassanio, Than to live still and write mine epitaph.
You cannot feed capons so.
You cannot revel into dukedoms there.
You cannot, if my heart were in your hand, Nor shall not, whilst ’tis in my custody.
You cannot, sir, take from me any thing that I will more willingly part withal—except my life, except my life, except my life.
You cataracts and hurricanoes, spout Till you have drenched our steeples, drowned the cocks!
You charge me most unjustly.
You cloudy princes and heart-sorrowing peers That bear this heavy mutual load of moan, Now cheer each other in each other’s love.
You come most carefully upon your hour.
You come not Like Caesar’s sister.
You come to me and you say, “Shylock, we would have moneys.” You say so!— You, that did void your rheum upon my beard And foot me as you spurn a stranger cur Over your threshold!
You come with letters against the king and take Vanity the puppet’s part against the royalty of her father.
You could never do him so ill-well unless you were the very man.
You could, for a need, study a speech of some dozen or sixteen lines which I would set down and insert in ’t, could you not?
You cram these words into mine ears against The stomach of my sense.
You dare easier be friends with me than fight with mine enemy.
You did know How much you were my conqueror, and that My sword, made weak by my affection, would Obey it on all cause.
You did.
You do advance your cunning more and more.
You do assist the storm.
You do but dally.
You do extend These thoughts of horror further than you shall Find cause in Caesar.
You do love my lord.
You do me wrong to take me out o' th' grave.
You do mistake me, sir.
You do mistake your business.
You do not mind the play.
You do remember all the circumstance?
You draw me, you hard-hearted adamant.
You durst not so have tempted him.
You embrace your charge too willingly.
You English princes all, I do salute you.
You envy my advancement, and my friends'.
You ever gentle gods, take my breath from me.
You forget yourself To hedge me in.
You gentle Romans—     Peace, ho!
You go to seek the Lord Hamlet.
You had musty victual, and he hath holp to eat it.
You have a daughter called Elizabeth, Virtuous and fair, royal and gracious.
You have among you killed a sweet and innocent lady.
You have among you many a purchased slave, Which—like your asses and your dogs and mules— You use in abject and in slavish parts Because you bought them.
You have an excellent armor, but let my horse have his due.
You have astonished him.
You have been factious one against the other.— Wife, love Lord Hastings.
You have been hotly called for.
You have been nobly borne.
You have broken The article of your oath, which you shall never Have tongue to charge me with.
You have dancing shoes With nimble soles.
You have displaced the mirth, broke the good meeting, With most admired disorder.
You have done that you should be sorry for.
You have done well by water.
You have done well, That men must lay their murders on your neck.
You have forgot the will I told you of.
You have good judgment in horsemanship.
You have heard him swear downright he was.
You have heard much.
You have her father’s love, Demetrius.
You have it full, Benedick.
You have killed a sweet lady, and her death shall fall heavy on you.
You have known what you should not.
You have little cause to say so.
You have lost no reputation at all unless you repute yourself such a loser.
You have loved him well.
You have made me offer Of Sicily, Sardinia.
You have me, have you not?
You have my consent.
You have no stomach, Signior.
You have not been abed, then?
You have not called me so, nor have you cause.
You have not seen such a thing as ’tis.
You have obtained it.
You have of late stood out against your brother, and he hath ta'en you newly into his grace, where it is impossible you should take true root but by the fair weather that you make yourself.
You have prevailed.
You have put him down, lady, you have put him down.
You have said now.
You have said, but whether wisely or no, let the forest judge.
You have said, sir.
You have seen cruel proof of this man’s strength.
You have seen nothing then?
You have served me well, And kings have been your fellows.
You have simply misused our sex in your love-prate.
You have some cause; they have not.
You have spoken truer than you purposed.
You have stayed me in a happy hour.
You have taken it wiselier than I meant you should.
You have told me she hath received them and returned me expectations and comforts of sudden respect and acquaintance, but I find none.
You have too courtly a wit for me.
You have too much respect upon the world.
You have trained me like a peasant, obscuring and hiding from me all gentlemanlike qualities.
You have, my lord.
You hear him all night.
You hear how he importunes me.
You hear the suit.
You heard her say herself it was not I.
You jig and amble, and you lisp, you nickname God’s creatures and make your wantonness your ignorance.
You keep by land The legions and the horse whole, do you not?
You kill me to deny it.
You kiss by th' book.
You knew my father well, and in him me, Left solely heir to all his lands and goods, Which I have bettered rather than decreased.
You knew—none so well, none so well as you—of my daughter’s flight.
You know he does.
You know I gave it you even now.
You know I gave it you half an hour since.
You know I say nothing to him, for he understands not me, nor I him.
You know me by my habit.
You know me well, and herein spend but time To wind about my love with circumstance.
you know me well.
You know me well.
You know my mind.
You know no Centaur?
You know not how to choose a man.
You know not what you do.
You know not Whether it was his wisdom or his fear.
You know not why we came to visit you— Thus out of season, threading dark-eyed night.
You know sometimes he walks four hours together Here in the lobby.
You know that I held Epicurus strong And his opinion.
You know that you are Brutus that speak this, Or, by the gods, this speech were else your last.
You know the character to be your brother’s?
You know the law.
You know tomorrow is the wedding day.
You know, he brought me out o' favor with my lady about a bear-baiting here.
You lack a man’s heart.
You laugh when boys or women tell their dreams.
You lie out on ’t, sir, and therefore it is not yours.
You lie up to the hearing of the gods.
You lie.
You look angerly.
You look as you had something more to say.
You look not well, Signor Antonio.
You look pale, and gaze, And put on fear, and cast yourself in wonder To see the strange impatience of the heavens.
You look wearily.
You love me not.
You make me study of that.
You mar our labor.
You may as well do anything most hard, As seek to soften that—than which what’s harder?— His Jewish heart.
You may as well go about to turn the sun to ice with fanning in his face with a peacock’s feather.
You may as well say, that’s a valiant flea that dare eat his breakfast on the lip of a lion.
You may be pleased to catch at mine intent By what did here befall me.
You may be rightly just, Whatever I shall think.
You may do then in time.
You may do your will, But he’s a tried and valiant soldier.
You may gather more.
You may go to the devil’s dam!
You may have very fit occasion for ’t.
You may light on a husband that hath no beard.
You may relish him more in the soldier than in the scholar.
You may tell every finger I have with my ribs.
You may think I love you not.
You may think perchance that I think you are in love.
You may, sir.
You mean, to bear me, not to bear with me.— Uncle, my brother mocks both you and me.
You men of Cyprus, let her have your knees.
You might do much.
You might have come before.
You might have saved me my pains to have taken it away yourself.
You minion, you, are these your customers?
You mistake, sir, you mistake, sir.
You mistake, sir.
You mock me, madam.
You mock me, sir.
You must away tonight.
You must awhile be patient.
You must be father to your brother’s daughter, And give her to young Claudio.
You must bear with me.
You must call forth the watch that are their accusers.
You must contrary me.
You must have patience, madam.
You must leave this.
You must needs yield your reason, Sir Andrew.
You must not deny me.
You must not look so sour.
You must not stay here longer.
You must not think I am so simple but I know the devil himself will not eat a woman.
You must not think then that I am drunk.
You must not, sir, mistake my niece.
You must note beside, That we have tried the utmost of our friends, Our legions are brim-full, our cause is ripe.
You must play Pyramus.—And Flute, you Thisbe.
You must say “paragon.” A “paramour” is, God bless us, a thing of naught.
You must sing  This nothing’s more than matter.
You must think this, look you, that the worm will do his kind.
You must to Parthia.
You must translate.
You need not fear, lady, the having any of these lords.
You need not tell us what Lord Hamlet said.
You nimble lightnings, dart your blinding flames Into her scornful eyes!
You or any man living may be drunk at a time, man.
You pay him then.
You peasant swain!
You peers, continue this united league.
You praise yourself By laying defects of judgment to me, but You patched up your excuses.
You received no gold?
You rise to play and go to bed to work.
You rub the sore When you should bring the plaster.
You said the enemy would not come down But keep the hills and upper regions.
You saw my master wink and laugh upon you?
You saw they speak us fair, give us gold.
You say he dined at home; the goldsmith here Denies that saying.
You say not right, old man.
You say very true, scald knave, when God’s will is.
You say well.
You say you are a better soldier.
You say you do not know the lady’s mind.
You scarcely have the hearts to tell me so, And therefore cannot have the hearts to do it.
You see an ass head of your own, do you?
You see her eyes are open.
You see how easily she may be surprised.
You see how full of changes his age is.
You see how simple and how fond I am.
You see me here, you gods, a poor old man, As full of grief as age, wretched in both.
You see me, Lord Bassanio, where I stand Such as I am.
You sent me for a rope’s end as soon.
You sent me to the bay, sir, for a bark.
You shall advise me in all for Cleopatra.
You shall be a woodmonger and buy nothing of me but cudgels.
You shall be king.
You shall be more beloving than beloved.
You shall be soon dispatched with fair conditions.
You shall close prisoner rest Till that the nature of your fault be known To the Venetian state.—Come, bring him away.
You shall confess that you are both deceived.
You shall do marvelous wisely, good Reynaldo, Before you visit him, to make inquire Of his behavior.
You shall do small respect, show too bold malice Against the grace and person of my master, Stocking his messenger.
You shall find me apt enough to that, sir, an you will give me occasion.
You shall have anything.
You shall have gold To pay the petty debt twenty times over.
You shall have leave.
You shall have letters from me to my son In your behalf, to meet you on the way.
You shall Have letters from me to some friends that will Sweep your way for you.
You shall have none ill, sir, for I’ll try if they can lick their fingers.
You shall have ransom.
You shall have some part of your will.
You shall have the mustard Or else you get no beef of Grumio.
You shall have time to wrangle in when you have nothing else to do.
You shall have wine enough, my lord, anon.
You shall hear me.
You shall hear more by midnight.
You shall hear more.
You shall know more hereafter.
You shall mark Many a duteous and knee-crooking knave That (doting on his own obsequious bondage) Wears out his time much like his master’s ass For naught but provender, and when he’s old, cashiered.
You shall never take her without her answer unless you take her without her tongue.
You shall not choose but drink before you go.
You shall not find, Though you be therein curious, the least cause For what you seem to fear.
You shall not gauge me By what we do tonight.
You shall not go, my lord.
You shall not go.
You shall not in your funeral speech blame us, But speak all good you can devise of Caesar, And say you do ’t by our permission.
You shall not seal to such a bond for me!
You shall not stir out of your house today.
You shall play it in a mask, and you may speak as small as you will.
You shall read us the will, Caesar’s will.
You shall see anon how the murderer gets the love of Gonzago’s wife.
You shall try but one fall.
You shall, Mark Antony.
You shall, my lord.
You should ask me what time o' day.
You should be ruled and led By some discretion that discerns your state Better than you yourself.
You should for that have reprehended him.
You should hear reason.
You should then have accosted her, and with some excellent jests, fire-new from the mint, you should have banged the youth into dumbness.
You slave, you cur!
You speak all your part at once, cues and all.—Pyramus, enter.
You speak not as you think.
You speak this to fetch me in, my lord.
You speak to Casca, and to such a man That is no fleering telltale.
You speak too bitterly.
You spoke not with her since?
You spurn me hence, and he will spurn me hither.
You stand amazed, But be of comfort.
You stand.
You stayed well by ’t in Egypt.
You strike my people, and your disordered rabble Make servants of their betters.
You sulfurous and thought-executing fires, Vaunt-couriers of oak-cleaving thunderbolts, Singe my white head!
You sunburnt sicklemen of August weary, Come hither from the furrow and be merry.
You swore to me when I did give it you That you would wear it till your hour of death, And that it should lie with you in your grave.
You take my house when you do take the prop That doth sustain my house.
You take my life When you do take the means whereby I live.
You take pleasure then in the message?
You take your pennyworths now.
You talk!
You tallow face!
You taught me first to beg, and now methinks You teach me how a beggar should be answered.
You taught me language, and my profit on ’t Is I know how to curse.
You tell us the manner of the wrestling.
You the like loss?
You think I’ll weep?
You think none but your sheets are privy to your wishes.
You think of him too much.
You thought because he could not speak English in the native garb, he could not therefore handle an English cudgel.
You told a lie, an odious, damnèd lie.
You told me so.
You told me you salute not at the court but you kiss your hands.
You touched my vein at first.
You tremble and look pale.
You understand me?
You use this dalliance to excuse Your breach of promise to the Porpentine.
You were best go in.
You were best knock louder.
You were best to tell Antonio what you hear— Yet do not suddenly, for it may grieve him.
You were kneeled to and importuned otherwise By all of us, and the fair soul herself Weighed between loathness and obedience, at Which end o' th' beam should bow.
You were sent for, and there is a kind of confession in your looks which your modesties have not craft enough to color.
You were the word of war.
You were to blame, I must be plain with you, To part so slightly with your wife’s first gift, A thing stuck on with oaths upon your finger And so riveted with faith unto your flesh.
You whoreson malt-horse drudge!
You will answer, “The slaves are ours.” So do I answer you.
You will be schoolmaster And undertake the teaching of the maid: That’s your device.
You will be whipped.
You will compel me, then, to read the will?
You will have Gremio to keep you fair.
You will lose this wager, my lord.
You will never run mad, niece.
You will not then?
You will take little delight in it, I can tell you, there is such odds in the man.
You would all this time have proved there is no time for all things.
You would be satisfied?
You would lift the moon out of her sphere if she would continue in it five weeks without changing.
You would say so, master, if your garments were thin.
You would seem to know my stops.
You wrong me every way.
You wrong me more, sir, in denying it.
You wrong me, Brutus.
You wrong me, Signior Gremio.
You wronged yourself to write in such a case.
You, as your business and desire shall point you— For every man has business and desire, Such as it is—and for my own poor part, Look you, I’ll go pray.
You, constable, are to present the Prince’s own person.
You, cousin.
You, mistress, all this coil is long of you.
You, Nick Bottom, are set down for Pyramus.
You, Pyramus' father.—Myself, Thisbe’s father.—Snug the joiner, you, the lion’s part.—And I hope here is a play fitted.
You, Roderigo!
You, sir?
You, uncivil lady, To whose ingrate and unauspicious altars My soul the faithfull’st off'rings have breathed out That e'er devotion tendered—what shall I do?
You, you, ay, you!
You, you, sirrah, where’s my daughter?
You!
You.
You’d be king o' th' isle, sirrah?
You’ll “never trust his word after.” Come, ’tis a foolish saying.
You’ll ask me why I rather choose to have A weight of carrion flesh than to receive Three thousand ducats.
You’ll be sick tomorrow For this night’s watching.
You’ll bear me a bang for that, I fear.
You’ll cry for this, minion, if I beat the door down.
You’ll find it otherwise, I assure you.
You’ll have coursers for cousins and gennets for germans.
You’ll have your nephews neigh to you.
You’ll heat my blood.
You’ll let us in, I hope?
You’ll not endure him!
You’ll pay me the eight shillings I won of you at betting?
You’ll win two days upon me.
You’re fall’n into a princely hand.
You’re much deceived.
You’re sad, Signior Balthasar.
You’re welcome hither.
You’re welcome, sir, and he for your good sake.
You’ve said, sir.
You’ve strange serpents there?
Young boys and girls Are level now with men.
Young budding virgin, fair and fresh and sweet, Whither away, or where is thy abode?
Young Edward lives; think now what I would speak.
Young Fortinbras, with conquest come from Poland, To th' ambassadors of England gives This warlike volley.
Young fry of treachery!
Young gentleman, your spirits are too bold for your years.
Young man, have you challenged Charles the wrestler?
Young men’s love then lies Not truly in their hearts, but in their eyes.
Young Romeo is it?
Young son, it argues a distempered head So soon to bid good morrow to thy bed.
Younger than she are happy mothers made.
Younger than you Here in Verona, ladies of esteem Are made already mothers.
Youngling, thou canst not love so dear as I.   Graybeard, thy love doth freeze.
Your  It is not a fashion for the maids in France to kiss before they are married, would she say?
Your accent is something finer than you could purchase in so removed a dwelling.
Your answer to that?
Your answer, sir, is enigmatical.
Your bedchamber.
Your betters have endured me say my mind, And if you cannot, best you stop your ears.
Your betters, sir.
Your brother Gloucester hates you.
Your brother is but young and tender, and, for your love I would be loath to foil him, as I must for my own honor if he come in.
Your brother the Bastard is fled from Messina.
Your brother—no, no brother—yet the son— Yet not the son, I will not call him son— Of him I was about to call his father Hath heard your praises, and this night he means To burn the lodging where you use to lie, And you within it.
Your cake there is warm within; you stand here in the cold.
Your case is better.
Your castle is surprised, your wife and babes Savagely slaughtered.
Your cause of sorrow Must not be measured by his worth, for then It hath no end.
Your charm so strongly works 'em That if you now beheld them, your affections Would become tender.
Your children shall be kings.
Your children were vexation to your youth, But mine shall be a comfort to your age.
Your commission’s ready.
Your constancy Hath left you unattended.
Your cousin, my lady, takes great exceptions to your ill hours.
Your crown’s awry.
Your Dane, your German, and your swag-bellied Hollander—Drink, ho!—are nothing to your English.
Your daughter here the princes left for dead.
Your daughter spent in Genoa, as I heard, in one night fourscore ducats.
Your dinner, and the generous islanders By you invited, do attend your presence.
Your ear is good.
Your eldest daughters have fordone themselves, And desperately are dead.
Your Emperor Continues still a Jove.
Your eyes are lodestars, and your tongue’s sweet air More tunable than lark to shepherd’s ear When wheat is green, when hawthorn buds appear.
Your eyes do menace me.
Your eyes drop millstones, when fools' eyes drop tears.
Your face, my thane, is as a book where men May read strange matters.
Your father got excellent husbands, if a maid could come by them.
Your father was ever virtuous, and holy men at their death have good inspirations.
Your features, Lord warrant us!
Your fortunes are alike.
Your friends are up and buckle on their armor.
Your friends at Pomfret, they do need the priest; Your Honor hath no shriving work in hand.
Your gentleness shall force More than your force move us to gentleness.
Your goods that lay at host, sir, in the Centaur.
Your Grace attended to their sugared words But looked not on the poison of their hearts.
Your Grace does me as great honors as can be desired in the hearts of his subjects.
Your grace hath laid the odds o' th' weaker side.
Your Grace is too costly to wear every day.
Your Grace may do your pleasure.
Your Grace, we think, should soonest know his mind.
Your graces are right welcome.
Your grandfather of famous memory, an’t please your Majesty, and your great-uncle Edward the Plack Prince of Wales, as I have read in the chronicles, fought a most prave pattle here in France.
Your hand, Leonato.
Your hands, come then.
Your heart is burst, you have lost half your soul.
Your heart’s desires be with you.
Your Highness bade me ask for it today.
Your Highness told me I should post before.
Your honor calls you hence.
Your honor is most welcome.
Your Honor wins bad humors.
Your Honor’s players, hearing your amendment, Are come to play a pleasant comedy, For so your doctors hold it very meet, Seeing too much sadness hath congealed your blood, And melancholy is the nurse of frenzy.
Your houses!
Your husband being troubled with a shrew Measures my husband’s sorrow by his woe.
Your lady mother is coming to your chamber.
Your lady, sir, your lady.
Your ladyship were best to have some guard about you if he come, for sure the man is tainted in ’s wits.
Your letters did withhold our breaking forth Till we perceived both how you were wrong led And we in negligent danger.
Your lips will feel them the sooner.
Your looks are pale and wild, and do import Some misadventure.
Your lord does know my mind.
Your lordship is right welcome back to Denmark.
Your lordship speaks most infallibly of him.
Your loss is as yourself, great, and you bear it As answering to the weight.
Your love says, like an honest gentleman, 'Where is your mother?
Your love says, like an honest gentleman, and a courteous, and a kind, and a handsome, and, I warrant, a virtuous— Where is your mother?
Your loves, as mine to you.
Your Majesty came not like yourself.
Your Majesty says very true.
Your Majesty shall mock at me.
Your Majesty, hear now, saving your Majesty’s manhood, what an arrant, rascally, beggarly, lousy knave it is.
Your man and you are marvelous merry, sir.
Your mind may change.
Your mistress bears well.
Your mistress sent to have me home to dinner?
Your mother.
Your name, I pray you, friend?
Your name, sir, truly.
Your names?
Your old smock brings forth a new petticoat, and indeed the tears live in an onion that should water this sorrow.
Your overkindness doth wring tears from me.
Your part in her you could not keep from death, But heaven keeps his part in eternal life.
Your plainness and your shortness please me well.
Your plantain leaf is excellent for that.
Your power and your command is taken off And Cassio rules in Cyprus.
Your praise is come too swiftly home before you.
Your reason?
Your reason.
Your reasons are too shallow and too quick.
Your reproof is something too round.
Your royal father’s murdered.
Your royal preparation Makes us hear something.
Your rye-straw hats put on, And these fresh nymphs encounter every one In country footing.
Your serpent of Egypt is bred now of your mud by the operation of your sun.
Your servant Kent.
Your servant shall do so.
Your servants ever Have theirs, themselves, and what is theirs in compt, To make their audit at your highness' pleasure, Still to return your own.
Your servants tend.
Your shoes is not so good.
Your sister is the better soldier.
Your son and daughter found this trespass worth The shame which here it suffers.
Your son shall have my daughter with consent.
Your son, my lord, has paid a soldier’s debt.
Your statue spouting blood in many pipes, In which so many smiling Romans bathed, Signifies that from you great Rome shall suck Reviving blood, and that great men shall press For tinctures, stains, relics, and cognizance.
Your sword upon a woman?
Your tale, sir, would cure deafness.
Your vessels and your spells provide, Your charms and everything beside.
Your virtue is my privilege.
Your voice shall be as strong as any man’s In the disposing of new dignities.
Your way is shorter.
Your wife and brother Made wars upon me, and their contestation Was theme for you.
Your wife Octavia, with her modest eyes And still conclusion, shall acquire no honor Demuring upon me.
Your wife would give you little thanks for that If she were by to hear you make the offer.
Your will?
Your wives, your daughters, Your matrons, and your maids could not fill up The cistern of my lust, and my desire All continent impediments would o'erbear That did oppose my will.
Your Worship is deceived.
Your worship speaks like a most thankful and reverent youth, and I praise God for you.
Your worship was wont to tell me that I could do nothing without bidding.
Your worship’s friend and Launcelot, sir.
Your worth is very dear in my regard.
Your wrongs do set a scandal on my sex.
Yours by this hand.
Yours in the ranks of death.
Yours, if you talk of tales.
Yours, yours.
Youth to itself rebels, though none else near.
Zounds, a dog, a rat, a mouse, a cat to scratch a man to death!
Zounds, he dies!
Zounds, hold your peace.
Zounds, I’ll entreat no more.
Zounds, sir, you’re robbed!
Zounds, who is there?
